page.title: 14MAKING STAIRCASES AT GLYNDE
page.content: {Spiral Staircases}is a small family firm that started in 1964 in an old stable in Lewes employing 2 people. Now it has 24 workers in an old disused mill in Glynde. The firm found it would be cheaper to rent the mill from the Glynde estates than set up in the town. The staircases are made of metal, wood and perspex. The perspex is moulded on wooden frames and then heated. Some of the oak plywood treads are covered with veneer. The mill is used as a workshop. There is a woodwork room, metalworking room, draughting and design and office. The cheapest staircase is about Â£1000 to Â£35000 for one 5 storeys high. 10% go abroad, 60% to private houses and 20% to shops, offices and banks. Many staircases are exported to Saudi Arabia and other places abroad. All the staircases are for internal use.
